title: IKEA Just Made an Extension Cord You’ll Actually Want to Display
description: We know, we know—extension cords aren’t exactly the sexiest item in your home. But what if we told you IKEA made one that’s sleek, smart, and dare we say… decor-worthy? Enter the IKEA SKOTAT extension cord, a refreshingly design-forward take on the everyday power strip. It’s the kind of thing that blends in so beautifully, you’ll forget it’s even there—until you need it to charge your laptop, phone, tablet, or all three at once. Let’s plug in and unpack why […] The post IKEA Just Made an Extension Cord You’ll Actually Want to Display appeared first on IKEA Hackers.
author: Jules Yap
excerpt: IKEA transforms a boring household essential into a stylish, sage green design piece. Discover how the IKEA SKOTAT extension cord blends function, form, and fast charging—with a clever IKEA twist.
text: We know, we know—extension cords aren’t exactly the sexiest item in your home. But what if we told you IKEA made one that’s sleek, smart, and dare we say… decor-worthy? Enter the IKEA SKOTAT extension cord, a refreshingly design-forward take on the everyday power strip. It’s the kind of thing that blends in so beautifully, you’ll forget it’s even there—until you need it to charge your laptop, phone, tablet, or all three at once. Let’s plug in and unpack why SKOTAT deserves a spot in your home (and not behind the sofa). The Power Triangle SKOTAT Extension Cord | Photo Credit: IKEA.com At first glance, SKOTAT doesn’t look like your average power strip. That’s because it isn’t. It’s triangular. This clever geometry means SKOTAT can nestle into corners, sit neatly on a shelf, or even be hung up like a little design object. Finally, a plug strip that blends into corners. Design, Meet Utility In classic IKEA fashion, SKOTAT is available in an unconventional color as far as extension cords go. No black or white here. Rather, the SKOTAT is a muted green that plays well with modern interiors, especially earthy, minimalist, or Scandi-inspired spaces. The Clever Details That Set It Apart SKOTAT Extension Cord | Photo Credit: IKEA.com The IKEA SKOTAT extension Cord comes loaded with savvy design features that make it a standout (and perhaps, worth the $39.99 price tag?) Plus-shaped holes at the back: Hang it up, stick it on, or stand it up in a corner. SKOTAT can be wall-mounted in any orientation—upside down, sideways, angled—it’s entirely up to you. Hang it on a peg rail, hook, or screw for a power station that’s always within reach. No sliding around: If you prefer to place SKOTAT on a flat surface like your desk or shelf, you’ll love this: IKEA includes thermoplastic rubber (TPE) plugs that fit into those back holes, giving it a non-slip grip that keeps it from sliding across the surface. USB-C = fast, smart charging: It also comes with a USB-C port that supports fast charging, perfect for juicing up your phone or tablet. Bonus: it can even charge most laptops, depending on your device’s power requirements. (Pro tip: charging speed will depend on the specific tech you’re using.) Three grounded outlets: SKOTAT includes three sockets to handle your daily tech load—laptop, desk lamp, ring light, printer—you name it. Cord length that just works: A 1.5-meter (about 5 feet) cord offers a decent amount of length. Don’t Let Cables Kill the Vibe: Cable Management Matters SKOTAT Extension Cord | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Here’s the truth: even the best-looking extension cord won’t save your setup if your cables are a hot mess. To let SKOTAT shine the way it was meant to, smart cable management is a must. Bundle the chaos. Use ALFORSIT cable ties to wrangle long, loopy cords into neat little bundles. They’re reusable, adjustable, and way more attractive than twist ties. Keep cables where they belong. Add KALKSTUFF cord holders along the edge of your work desk to guide cables exactly where you want them. Hide and glide. Run cables along baseboards or under the desk with the IKEA FÖRSÄSONG cable management tray, or tuck them under a floating shelf. Make Everyday Things Functional and Beautiful The IKEA SKOTAT proves that an extension cord can be aesthetic. It’s compact, good-looking, and full of thoughtful features that make powering your space easier and more stylish. Whether you’re organizing your home office, refreshing your nightstand setup, or just want to stop hiding your extension cord, SKOTAT is a surprisingly delightful upgrade. What’s your SKOTAT setup look like? Share your snaps with us @ikeahackersofficial. html:
We know, we know—extension cords aren’t exactly the sexiest item in your home. But what if we told you IKEA made one that’s sleek, smart, and dare we say… decor-worthy?

Enter the IKEA SKOTAT extension cord, a refreshingly design-forward take on the everyday power strip. It’s the kind of thing that blends in so beautifully, you’ll forget it’s even there—until you need it to charge your laptop, phone, tablet, or all three at once.

Let’s plug in and unpack why SKOTAT deserves a spot in your home (and not behind the sofa).

The Power Triangle

At first glance, SKOTAT doesn’t look like your average power strip. That’s because it isn’t.

It’s triangular.

This clever geometry means SKOTAT can nestle into corners, sit neatly on a shelf, or even be hung up like a little design object. Finally, a plug strip that blends into corners.

Design, Meet Utility

In classic IKEA fashion, SKOTAT is available in an unconventional color as far as extension cords go. No black or white here.

Rather, the SKOTAT is a muted green that plays well with modern interiors, especially earthy, minimalist, or Scandi-inspired spaces.

The Clever Details That Set It Apart

The IKEA SKOTAT extension Cord comes loaded with savvy design features that make it a standout (and perhaps, worth the $39.99 price tag?)

Plus-shaped holes at the back: Hang it up, stick it on, or stand it up in a corner. SKOTAT can be wall-mounted in any orientation—upside down, sideways, angled—it’s entirely up to you. Hang it on a peg rail, hook, or screw for a power station that’s always within reach.

No sliding around: If you prefer to place SKOTAT on a flat surface like your desk or shelf, you’ll love this: IKEA includes thermoplastic rubber (TPE) plugs that fit into those back holes, giving it a non-slip grip that keeps it from sliding across the surface.

USB-C = fast, smart charging: It also comes with a USB-C port that supports fast charging, perfect for juicing up your phone or tablet. Bonus: it can even charge most laptops, depending on your device’s power requirements. (Pro tip: charging speed will depend on the specific tech you’re using.)

Three grounded outlets: SKOTAT includes three sockets to handle your daily tech load—laptop, desk lamp, ring light, printer—you name it.

Cord length that just works: A 1.5-meter (about 5 feet) cord offers a decent amount of length.

Don’t Let Cables Kill the Vibe: Cable Management Matters

Here’s the truth: even the best-looking extension cord won’t save your setup if your cables are a hot mess. To let SKOTAT shine the way it was meant to, smart cable management is a must.

  • Bundle the chaos. Use ALFORSIT cable ties to wrangle long, loopy cords into neat little bundles. They’re reusable, adjustable, and way more attractive than twist ties.
  • Keep cables where they belong. Add KALKSTUFF cord holders along the edge of your work desk to guide cables exactly where you want them.
  • Hide and glide. Run cables along baseboards or under the desk with the IKEA FÖRSÄSONG cable management tray, or tuck them under a floating shelf.

Make Everyday Things Functional and Beautiful

The IKEA SKOTAT proves that an extension cord can be aesthetic. It’s compact, good-looking, and full of thoughtful features that make powering your space easier and more stylish.

Whether you’re organizing your home office, refreshing your nightstand setup, or just want to stop hiding your extension cord, SKOTAT is a surprisingly delightful upgrade.

What’s your SKOTAT setup look like? Share your snaps with us @ikeahackersofficial.
